title: Congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine upon the occasion of celebrating their 50th Wedding Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine upon
the occasion of celebrating their 50th Wedding Anniversary

WHEREAS, Wendell  Saul  Castine  and  Emily  Flachbart  were  united  in
marriage on October 8, 1960, at the First Presbyterian Church of Platts-
burgh,  New  York,  with services provided by the Reverend George Grose;
and
  WHEREAS, To celebrate this auspicious event, a dinner party and recep-
tion was held in their honor at the Elks Lodge in Plattsburgh on October
9, 2010, hosted by their devoted children, with many friends and  family
members in attendance; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition, Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine participated in a
renewal of vows ceremony at the Chazy Presbyterian Church the day  after
the  event, officiated by the Reverend Miriam Hathaway, and are planning
an anniversary trip for the spring of 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The happy couple are now enjoying their  retirement  together
after  many  years of distinguished service to the workforce; both loyal
employees, Wendell was a bus driver for the Northeastern Central  School
District  and  Emily was the high school librarian for the Chazy Central
School District; and
  WHEREAS, Currently, Mrs. Castine is serving as the moderator of  Pres-
byterian   Women   of   the   Northern  New  York  Presbytery,  covering
churchwomen's groups from Sacket's Harbor to Rouses Point, and is pursu-
ing her commissioned lay pastor certification online through the Univer-
sity of Dubuque Theological Seminary in Iowa; and
  WHEREAS, They are the proud parents of two wonderful children, Timothy
and Tracey and the loving grandparents of one grandson, Joshua; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine are and always have been a tower
of strength, support, understanding and limitless love for their family;
and
  WHEREAS, Their love, devotion, caring, sensitivity and  responsiveness
to  their  family,  friends and all who know them are their hallmark and
tradition; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine have lived and continue to  live
their lives with great dignity and genuine grace, always demonstrating a
deep  and  continuing  concern  for  human  values and ideals, and in so
doing, they have inspired others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS, This meaningful occasion is the result of the love, hard work
and spirit this couple has invested in their marriage; and
  WHEREAS, These same values they  have  passed  to  their  loved  ones,
producing  a  family that is close-knit and supportive of its individual
members, public-minded in its relations to the community  and  committed
to the ideals of citizenship upon which this Nation was founded; and
  WHEREAS,  Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine have touched the lives of their
family and many friends through the shining example of  their  marriage,
which  is  a testament to the devotion and admiration which they possess
for one another; and
  WHEREAS, The longevity of this enduring marriage truly marks  a  mile-
stone in life's journey, an event of personal triumph and joy; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when an occa-
sion of such importance is brought to our attention, the same should  be
memorialized  by  us  for  the edification and emulation of others; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine upon the occasion of celebrat-
ing their 50th Wedding Anniversary; and be it further

  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Mr. and Mrs. Wendell Castine, Plattsburgh, New York.
